page.title: 12Near Grantham:Old Somerby.
page.content: The western end of the village of Old Somerby lies in the area under survey.As the majority of the village is situated in the 3*4 kilometre block to the east we will only describe the western end which contains some housing. There is the old post office now only a private dwelling house. Opposite on the road to Boothby Pagnell is the Fox and Hounds public house. This is well known in the area for the food it serves. Nearby across the road is the site of an old disused quarry. Old Somerby is a heathland village built on the limestone locally known as Ancaster stone.Consequently the old houses of the village are built of the lovely golden stone similar to that used in Cotswold villages.
